004
005package edu.wpi.first.math;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose3d;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation3d;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Transform3d;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation3d;
012
013public final class ComputerVisionUtil {
014  private ComputerVisionUtil() {
015    throw new AssertionError("utility class");
016  }
017
018  /**
019   * Algorithm from https://docs.limelightvision.io/en/latest/cs_estimating_distance.html Estimates
020   * range to a target using the target's elevation. This method can produce more stable results
021   * than SolvePNP when well tuned, if the full 6d robot pose is not required. Note that this method
022   * requires the camera to have 0 roll (not be skewed clockwise or CCW relative to the floor), and
023   * for there to exist a height differential between goal and camera. The larger this differential,
024   * the more accurate the distance estimate will be.
025   *
026   * <p>Units can be converted using the {@link edu.wpi.first.math.util.Units} class.
027   *
028   * @param cameraHeightMeters The physical height of the camera off the floor in meters.
029   * @param targetHeightMeters The physical height of the target off the floor in meters. This
030   *     should be the height of whatever is being targeted (i.e. if the targeting region is set to
031   *     top, this should be the height of the top of the target).
032   * @param cameraPitchRadians The pitch of the camera from the horizontal plane in radians.
033   *     Positive values up.
034   * @param targetPitchRadians The pitch of the target in the camera's lens in radians. Positive
035   *     values up.
036   * @param targetYawRadians The yaw of the target in the camera's lens in radians.
037   * @return The estimated distance to the target in meters.
038   */
039  public static double calculateDistanceToTarget(
040      double cameraHeightMeters,
041      double targetHeightMeters,
042      double cameraPitchRadians,
043      double targetPitchRadians,
044      double targetYawRadians) {
045    return (targetHeightMeters - cameraHeightMeters)
046        / (Math.tan(cameraPitchRadians + targetPitchRadians) * Math.cos(targetYawRadians));
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Estimate the position of the robot in the field.
051   *
052   * @param cameraHeightMeters The physical height of the camera off the floor in meters.
053   * @param targetHeightMeters The physical height of the target off the floor in meters. This
054   *     should be the height of whatever is being targeted (i.e. if the targeting region is set to
055   *     top, this should be the height of the top of the target).
056   * @param cameraPitchRadians The pitch of the camera from the horizontal plane in radians.
057   *     Positive values up.
058   * @param targetPitchRadians The pitch of the target in the camera's lens in radians. Positive
059   *     values up.
060   * @param targetYaw The observed yaw of the target. Note that this *must* be CCW-positive, and
061   *     Photon returns CW-positive.
062   * @param gyroAngle The current robot gyro angle, likely from odometry.
063   * @param fieldToTarget A Pose3d representing the target position in the field coordinate system.
064   * @param cameraToRobot The position of the robot relative to the camera. If the camera was
065   *     mounted 3 inches behind the "origin" (usually physical center) of the robot, this would be
066   *     new Transform3d(Units.inchesToMeters(3), Units.inchesToMeters(0), Units.inchesToMeters(0),
067   *     new Rotation3d(Units.degreesToRadians(0))).
068   * @return The position of the robot in the field.
069   */
070  public static Pose3d estimateFieldToRobot(
071      double cameraHeightMeters,
072      double targetHeightMeters,
073      double cameraPitchRadians,
074      double targetPitchRadians,
075      Rotation2d targetYaw,
076      Rotation2d gyroAngle,
077      Pose3d fieldToTarget,
078      Transform3d cameraToRobot) {
079    final var distanceAlongGround =
080        calculateDistanceToTarget(
081            cameraHeightMeters,
082            targetHeightMeters,
083            cameraPitchRadians,
084            targetPitchRadians,
085            targetYaw.getRadians());
086    final var range = Math.hypot(distanceAlongGround, targetHeightMeters - cameraHeightMeters);
087    return estimateFieldToRobot(
088        estimateCameraToTarget(
089            new Translation3d(
090                range, new Rotation3d(0.0, targetPitchRadians, targetYaw.getRadians())),
091            fieldToTarget,
092            gyroAngle),
093        fieldToTarget,
094        cameraToRobot);
095  }
096
097  /**
098   * Estimates the pose of the robot in the field coordinate system, given the position of the
099   * target relative to the camera, the target relative to the field, and the robot relative to the
100   * camera.
101   *
102   * @param cameraToTarget The position of the target relative to the camera.
103   * @param fieldToTarget The position of the target in the field.
104   * @param cameraToRobot The position of the robot relative to the camera. If the camera was
105   *     mounted 3 inches behind the "origin" (usually physical center) of the robot, this would be
106   *     new Transform3d(Units.inchesToMeters(3), Units.inchesToMeters(0), Units.inchesToMeters(0),
107   *     new Rotation3d(Units.degreesToRadians(0))).
108   * @return The position of the robot in the field.
109   */
110  public static Pose3d estimateFieldToRobot(
111      Transform3d cameraToTarget, Pose3d fieldToTarget, Transform3d cameraToRobot) {
112    return estimateFieldToCamera(cameraToTarget, fieldToTarget).transformBy(cameraToRobot);
113  }
114
115  /**
116   * Estimates a {@link Transform3d} that maps the camera position to the target position, using the
117   * robot's gyro. Note that the gyro angle provided *must* line up with the field coordinate system
118   * -- that is, it should read zero degrees when pointed towards the opposing alliance station, and
119   * increase as the robot rotates CCW.
120   *
121   * @param cameraToTargetTranslation A Translation3d that encodes the x/y position of the target
122   *     relative to the camera.
123   * @param fieldToTarget A Pose3d representing the target position in the field coordinate system.
124   * @param gyroAngle The current robot gyro angle, likely from odometry.
125   * @return A Transform3d that takes us from the camera to the target.
126   */
127  public static Transform3d estimateCameraToTarget(
128      Translation3d cameraToTargetTranslation, Pose3d fieldToTarget, Rotation2d gyroAngle) {
129    // Map our camera at the origin out to our target, in the robot reference
130    // frame. Gyro angle is needed because there's a circle of possible camera
131    // poses for which the camera has the same yaw from camera to target.
132    return new Transform3d(
133        cameraToTargetTranslation,
134        new Rotation3d(0.0, 0.0, -gyroAngle.getRadians()).minus(fieldToTarget.getRotation()));
135  }
136
137  /**
138   * Estimates the pose of the camera in the field coordinate system, given the position of the
139   * target relative to the camera, and the target relative to the field. This *only* tracks the
140   * position of the camera, not the position of the robot itself.
141   *
142   * @param cameraToTarget The position of the target relative to the camera.
143   * @param fieldToTarget The position of the target in the field.
144   * @return The position of the camera in the field.
145   */
146  public static Pose3d estimateFieldToCamera(Transform3d cameraToTarget, Pose3d fieldToTarget) {
147    var targetToCamera = cameraToTarget.inverse();
148    return fieldToTarget.transformBy(targetToCamera);
149  }
150}
